patterns.comment: after literal-function, which includes some prototype strings

ignore-long-lines.comment: long lines shouldn't be parsed for performance reasons as regex's are per line
so set at arbitary 1000 chars to avoid parsing minified files

patterns.comment: Assume flow typecasts start with a newline( or a :( or a =( or a ;(
try to avoid ternary operators which have a '? some chars :'
Use two forms of scopes! fixes some themes
patterns.name: string.quasi.js

patterns.comment: obj lteral ({ or ,{ or [{ or ={ or return { or default {
ternary operator - make sure end : is consumed to avoid mistake as flow type

literal-function-call.comment: maybe in array form e.g. foo[bar]()

patterns.comment: look for classes names but dont assume uppercase start char
patterns.name: entity.name.class.js

patterns.comment: attempt to find an assignment of a class field/property
with ASI we don't know quite where an expression ends so terminate when
a line starts with a static, [, name( or a semi-colon anywhere

literal-method-alternate.comment: opinionated form of a class method that is safe to leave in the expression block
it assumes methods start on a new line/statement and have a open brace on the same line

jsx.comment: Uses the JSX syntax as decribed at http://facebook.github.io/jsx/
together with the Unicode Spec http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr31/
but excludes using unicode esc characters, <ZWNJ> and <ZWJ> as per the draft. Will anyone use these?
Avoid < operator expressions as best we can using Zertosh's regex

patterns.comment: Trap tag <JSXElementName Where JSXElement Name = aaa.bbb
We use the tag name to form a completion for </JSXElementName>
as well as terminating a <JSXElementName /> form
Tags that end > are trapped in #jsx-tag-termination
patterns.name: meta.tag.jsx

patterns.comment: this matches the end > of an opening tag when in the form <tag> </tag>
uses non consuming search for </ in </tag>
non named flowtype returing a type T e.g. function x(arg, arg): T {} :
handled thus to avoid a function body brace being treated as an object literal type
maybe an issue if a object literal is returned and the start of func block isn't on same line!
name of variable with a flowtype : of type Function or (aaa)=> or (
name of variable spread var with optional ? and optional flowtype :
flowtype optional arg/parameter e.g. protocol? : string
patterns.name: punctuation.type.flowtype

patterns.comment: custom Class Types e.g. Abc avoid Abc(
custom primitive/var Types e.g. abc avoid abc(
as per React declares in flowtype github
patterns.name: kewyword.operator.existential.flowtype

patterns.comment: types of type marker e.g. <T: number | string>
patterns.name: punctuation.type.flowtype

patterns.comment: call back with a form  ) => type
Get parameters within a function/method call
Built-in Class Types with elements of type <T>
just the polymorph bit like this <K,V>(arg,arg)

flowtype-parse-objects.comment: object literal flowtype  preceded by either => : | & ? symbols

patterns.comment: name of property which can be a string

flowtype-parse-array.comment: arrays such as [name: string, dob: Date]

patterns.comment: type aliases for export but avoid type instaceof or type in operators
look for interface names but dont assume uppercase start char
patterns.name: support.type.class.interface.js

patterns.comment: look for module names but dont assume uppercase start char
patterns.name: entity.name.class.js

patterns.comment: look for module names in quoted string forms
look for mixin names but dont assume uppercase start char
patterns.name: entity.name.class.js

patterns.comment: look for class names but dont assume uppercase start char
patterns.name: entity.name.class.js

flowtype-literal-method.comment: trap methods without a name  e.g.   <Key, Value>(): Map<Key, Value>

patterns.comment: match arrow func symbol when it appears by itself
